newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss purchasing managers index slips in March.
newsitem.headline: Swiss purchasing managers index slips in March.

text.p: The Swiss Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) eased to 53.1 percent in March from a revised 53.9 percent in February, according to Credit Suisse and the Swiss Association for Material Management and Purchasing (SVME).
Credit Suisse and SVME said that despite the slight decline from February, the index reflected expansion in the industrial sector for the third month in a row.
Apart from the employment index, all sub-indices were above the 50 percent level, the report said.
The Swiss PMI, published since September 1995, is based on surveys in which companies are asked to rate eight sub-indices as higher, lower or unchanged from the month before.
The categories are production, orders on hand, purchasing volume, purchasing prices, delivery times, inventory purchases, inventory sales and business activity.
